member.name: T:OnionSeed.Data.IAsyncQueryService`2
member.summary: Defines a mechanism that can be used to asynchronously query entities from a data store.
member.typeparam: The type of entities in the data store.
The type of the unique identity value of the entities in the data store.

member.name: M:OnionSeed.Data.IAsyncQueryService`2.GetCountAsync
member.summary: Gets the number of entities in the data store.
member.returns: A task representing the operation. Upon completion, it will contain the number of entities in the data store.

member.name: M:OnionSeed.Data.IAsyncQueryService`2.GetAllAsync
member.summary: Begins an enumeration of all entities in the data store.
member.returns: A task representing the operation. Upon completion, it will contain an enumeration of all entities in the data store.

member.name: M:OnionSeed.Data.IAsyncQueryService`2.GetByIdAsync(`1)
member.summary: Gets a specific entity from the data store by its unique identity value.
member.param: The unique identity value of the entity.
member.returns: A task representing the operation. Upon completion, it will contain the entity that has the given unique identity value.
member.exception: is null.
The specified unique identity value does not exist in the data store.

member.name: M:OnionSeed.Data.IAsyncQueryService`2.TryGetByIdAsync(`1)
member.summary: Attempts to get a specific entity from the data store by its unique identity value.
member.param: The unique identity value of the entity.
member.returns: A task representing the operation. Upon completion, it will contain the entity that has the given unique identity value, or null if the specified entity was not found.
member.exception: is null.

member.summary: Commits any pending changes.
member.returns: A task representing the operation.

member.name: T:OnionSeed.Data.IEntity`1
member.summary: Defines an object that is not fundamentally identified by its attributes, but rather by a unique identity value.
member.typeparam: The type of the unique identity value.
member.remarks: Entities are not defined primarily by their attributes. They represent a thread of identity that runs through time and often across distinct representations. Sometimes an entity must be matched with another entity even though their attributes differ. Sometimes an entity must be distinguished from other entities even though their attributes are the same. Mistaken identity in these cases can lead to data corruption; thus, a unique identity value is created for the entity so it can be tracked regardless of the state of its attributes.

member.name: P:OnionSeed.Data.IEntity`1.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identity value.
